ai_agent_instructions.prompt_template: Generate a production-ready React component for WordPress admin interface implementing risk {risk_id}: {title}. The component must reflect the specific configuration defined in this risk's ui_configuration section.
ai_agent_instructions.output_format: React JSX component with Tailwind CSS styling and WordPress admin design system compatibility

required_imports: import { Button, ToggleControl, SelectControl, Notice, Spinner, Modal } from '@wordpress/components';

conditional_rendering_rules.instruction: Render ToggleControl with label={component.label}, help={component.description}, checked={state.enabled}, onChange={() => handleToggle(component.component_id)}. Add to state management system with persistence via WordPress options API.
conditional_rendering_rules.skip_if: No toggle controls defined in ui_configuration

conditional_rendering_rules.instruction: Render SelectControl with label={component.label}, help={component.description}, value={state.selectedOption}, options={component.options.map(opt => ({ label: opt, value: opt }))}, onChange={handleOptionChange}. Apply dependencies if component.dependencies array exists.
conditional_rendering_rules.skip_if: No dropdown controls defined in ui_configuration

conditional_rendering_rules.instruction: Render TextControl with appropriate validation rules from component.validation. Include input sanitization for WordPress admin.
conditional_rendering_rules.skip_if: No text inputs defined in ui_configuration

conditional_rendering_rules.instruction: Render CheckboxControl with multiple selection capability. Group related checkboxes when appropriate.
conditional_rendering_rules.skip_if: No checkbox controls defined in ui_configuration

conditional_rendering_rules.instruction: Render RadioControl with horizontal or vertical layout based on layout.preferred_orientation if specified.
conditional_rendering_rules.skip_if: No radio controls defined in ui_configuration

conditional_rendering_rules.instruction: Render RangeControl with min/max values, step increment, and current value display.
conditional_rendering_rules.skip_if: No slider controls defined in ui_configuration

collapsible.instruction: Wrap component section in WordPress <Panel> with <PanelBody> using title={title}, initialOpen={ui_configuration.layout.default_expanded}. Add expand/collapse animation.

action_handlers.instruction: Create handleEnableProtection() that: 1) Validates all required fields 2) Shows confirmation dialog if ui_configuration.actions[?(@.confirmation_required==true)] 3) Calls API endpoint /wp-json/vapt/v1/protection/{risk_id}/enable 4) Displays processing_message while loading 5) Shows success_message on success 6) Implements error_handler with fallback options 7) Triggers re-scan via verification_engine

Create handleScanNow() that: 1) Disables scan button during execution 2) Calls verification_engine.automated_checks script endpoints 3) Updates status_indicators based on results 4) Shows real-time progress via Notices 5) Logs results to verification_engine.continuous_monitoring

Create handleRemediate() that: 1) Creates backup if global_settings.backup_before_changes is true 2) Applies protection.automated_protection.implementation_steps sequentially 3) Verifies each step via protection.manual_steps[0].verification 4) Provides rollback option if global_settings.rollback_capability is true
action_handlers.skip_if: No automated_protection defined or remediation_effort == 'high' requires manual intervention

action_handlers.instruction: Create handleVerificationTest() that: 1) Executes each testing.verification_steps sequentially 2) Displays expected_result vs actual_result 3) Generates test report in export_formats 4) Includes command execution for steps with 'command' field not null

Create handleExportReport(format) that: 1) Collects current component state and scan results 2) Formats data according to reporting.export_formats 3) Triggers download with filename '{risk_id}_report_{timestamp}' 4) Enables share_capability with generated shareable link

severity_badge_system.instruction: Render severity badge using metadata.tags[1] or severity.level with conditional styling: critical: 'bg-red-100 text-red-800 border-red-200', high: 'bg-orange-100 text-orange-800 border-orange-200', medium: 'bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-800 border-yellow-200', low: 'bg-blue-100 text-blue-800 border-blue-200'. Add CVSS score tooltip: 'CVSS: {severity.cvss_score} ({severity.cvss_vector})'

status_indicator_system.instruction: For each reporting.status_indicators: 1) Render badge with display type 'badge' or 'pill' 2) Update message based on verification_engine.automated_checks.success_criteria 3) Add color coding: 'protected'  'bg-green-100 text-green-800', 'vulnerable'  'bg-red-100 text-red-800', 'partial'  'bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-800', 'unknown'  'bg-gray-100 text-gray-800'

hooks.useEffect: Fetch initial protection state from WordPress options: wp_options('vapt_protection_{risk_id}')
hooks.useState: Manage local state for all ui_configuration.components
hooks.useCallback: Memoize all action handlers for performance

wordpress_integration.nonce: Use wp_localize_script to inject VAPT.nonce for REST API authentication
wordpress_integration.admin_notices: Use WordPress Notice component for system-level messages

code_generation_rules.rule: All text strings must be wrapped in WordPress i18n function: __( 'string', 'vapt-protection' )
Use WordPress component library exclusively; avoid custom HTML elements when WordPress alternatives exist
Implement proper error boundaries for each major component section
Add ARIA labels and keyboard navigation support for accessibility compliance
Include loading states (Spinner component) for all async operations
Format code according to WordPress coding standards (tabs for indentation, braces on new lines)
Include PropTypes or TypeScript definitions if source_document indicates TypeScript support
Add unit test template matching risk-specific test_method from testing section

based_on_category.Authentication: Add login attempt counters, IP blocking interface, and password policy indicators
based_on_category.Configuration: Include wp-config.php editor preview and .htaccess rule visualizer
based_on_category.Information Disclosure: Add exposed endpoints list with severity ratings and quick-block toggles
based_on_category.API Security: Include API request logger, endpoint whitelist manager, and rate limit configurator

based_on_remediation_effort.medium: Provide step-by-step wizard with verification at each stage
based_on_remediation_effort.high: Add documentation link and expert consultation CTA

based_on_priority.8-10: Place in 'Critical Fixes' section at top of page, add urgency indicators
based_on_priority.5-7: Standard placement in respective category sections
based_on_priority.1-4: Group in 'Optional Hardening' section, default collapsed

responsive_behavior.mobile: Stack all controls vertically, full-width buttons, hide detailed descriptions behind tooltips
responsive_behavior.tablet: Two-column layout for controls, maintain visibility of status indicators
responsive_behavior.desktop: Use layout.order for precise positioning, show all metadata

examples.expected_output: Component with single toggle, backup warning modal (confirmation_required=true), and .htaccess code preview
Component with master toggle and nested dropdown for protection level with dependency chain
key_features: Test endpoint button with response preview

examples.expected_output: Component with toggle, threshold configuration slider, and IP whitelist management

validation_rules: All required components must be rendered with proper WordPress.components wrappers
Severity badges must use appropriate colors based on CVSS score: >=9.0=critical, >=7.0=high, >=4.0=medium, <4.0=low
Actions must include confirmation dialogs where ui_configuration.actions[?(@.confirmation_required==true)]
All testing.verification_steps must be represented as executable test buttons or automated scan triggers
Code examples must be displayed in syntax-highlighted pre blocks with copy functionality
Component must handle error states gracefully with user-friendly messages
All API calls must implement retry logic and timeout handling

performance_requirements.lazy_loading: Implement React.lazy() for all feature components
performance_requirements.caching: Cache verification_engine results for continuous_monitoring.frequency duration
